item.title: Kushal add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Reality continues to ruin my life." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Wil Wheaton
item.description: "Wil Wheaton Says: Don't be a dick." -- Wil Wheaton

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Roberto Bolano
item.description: "Books are finite, sexual encounters are finite, but the desire to read and to fuck is infinite; it surpasses our own deaths, our fears, our hopes for peace." -- Roberto Bolano

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "If they can get you asking the wrong questions, they don't have to worry about answers." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Men of God and men of war have strange affinities." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "The general public has long been divided into two parts; those who think that science can do anything and those who are afraid it will." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Charlie Chaplin
item.description: "In the end, everything is a gag." -- Charlie Chaplin

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Pankaj Mishra
item.description: "For, to be woken up at five in the morning by the devotional treacle of Anup Jalota, Hari Om Sharan and other confectioners, all of them simultaneously droning out from several different cassette players; to be relentlessly assaulted for the rest of the day and most of the night by the alternately over-earnest and insolent voices of Kumar Sanu, Alisha Chinoy, Baba Sehgal singing 'Sexy, Sexy, Sexy', and 'Ladki hai kya re baba', 'Sarkaye leyo khatiya' and other hideous songs; to have them insidiously leak into your memory and become moronic refrains running over and over again in your mind; to have your environment polluted and your day destroyed in this way was to know a deepening rage, an impulse to murder, and, finally, a creeping fear at one's own dangerous level of derangement. It was to understand the perfectly sane people you read about in the papers, who suddenly explode into violence one fine day; it was to conceive a lasting hatred for the perpetrators, rich or poor, of these auditory atrocities. (on why he left Varanasi after a few days)" -- Pankaj Mishra

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "All we are doing is telling each other things that can only be told by the rubbing together of two imperfect lumps of flesh. By doing this, we are sharing our imperfection." -- Anonymous

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Donkey shit everywhere. Here a shit, there a shit, the whole world is donkey shit." -- Anonymous

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "That’s how people live in the real world: forcing stuff on each other." -- Anonymous

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "an unfair society is a society that makes it possible for you to exploit your abilities to the limit." -- Anonymous

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "I’m all through as a human being,” she said. “All you’re looking at is the lingering memory of what I used to be. The most important part of me, what used to be inside, died years ago, and I’m just functioning by rote memory." -- Anonymous

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Walter Crocker
item.description: "in abolishing the British raj, and in propagating ideas of equality… Nehru and the upper-class Indian nationalists of English education abolished themselves. Nehru destroyed the Nehrus." -- Walter Crocker

item.title: Kushal add a quote by Walter Crocker
item.description: "But of no country is it so true as of India that the nearer one gets to the capital the further one gets from the realities." -- Walter Crocker
